page.title: 01Land North of St. Fergus
page.content: This is a flat coastal area. The prevailing wind is westerly, present even in summer. Visitors find it a bleak, cold place. There are no trees. The prominent feature being the beach coastline with sand dunes rising to 7m. Agriculturally poor, supporting six farms. Crops are wheat, rape, potatoes and swedes. The cattle, Aberdeen Angus feeding on poor grassland. In parts the topsoil is only 1m. Europes largest gas terminal is here. Shell Expro take natural gas liquids via undersea pipelines from North Sea fields. After processing, send the liquids by pipeline South to Mossmorran. Gas is supplied to British Gas Corporation to supply the national grid. The workforce to construct this complex were "travelling men" from the industrial belts of the South.
